GapFillInput.Title: Present perfect continuous with how long, for and since
GapFillInput.Instruction: Choose the correct form of the Present perfect continuous using the verb in brackets ( ). Type your answer in each gap, using short forms.

Content.Question:
In their free time, Mike and Ken work with Kids 'n Sport, a national club for young people. Erica is interviewing them for the local radio.
Erica: How long have you been playing (you / play) football, Mike?
Mike: I've been playing (I / play) all my life.
Erica: And how long have you been training (you / train) young footballers?
Mike: I haven't been working (I / not / work) here very long. I started about six months ago.
Erica: I believe your son trains with you.
Mike: Yes, he's been coming (he / come) here since January. He's really enjoying it and I think he's going to be good.
Erica: What about you, Ken? Have you been cycling (you / cycle) all your life?
Ken: No, I haven't. I began when I was fifteen, so let's see, that means I've been cycling (I / cycle) for about six years now.
Erica: Is this your new bike?
Ken: Yes, I've been using (I / use) it since last month. You can see it's very light and it goes very fast.
